title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Louisville

content.rendered:
No matter the way you see Louisville, you’ll make it to the winner’s circle. Louisville, Kentucky’s largest city, sits on the Ohio River along the Indiana border. A bumper sticker sums it up perfectly: “I wasn’t born in Kentucky, but I got here as fast as I could.” That being said, you’ll find a lot of opportunities to explore while living in this amazing city. That’s where Roomi comes in to help you find rooms for rent in Louisville. We’ll be your guide from Thoroughbreds that gallop around the track at historic Churchill Downs, to eating the best cheeseburgers which makes life in Louisville worthwhile!

Related: 16 Best Things To Do In Louisville

Getting to know Louisville

Autumn brings a mixture of color to Louisville. The city features a plethora of parks and graceful neighborhoods, as well as college campuses -all with enough turning leaves making fall the best time to explore the city. You can even nourish your love for the arts at the first-rate theaters and museums with your friends. If you’re looking to visualize your life in Louisville, Roomi has got your back! Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy this fun-filled city.

Finding rooms for rent in Louisville

The city’s built is is a mix of old and new, with historic neighborhoods comprised of Victorian houses and towering skyscrapers. But before looking for rooms for rent in Louisville let’s look into the neighborhoods to live in!

Find Rooms for Rent in Louisville

Top Neighborhoods in Louisville

  • Clifton: Clifton’s narrow streets are lined with sturdy New Orleans-style shotgun houses, long and narrow. This neighborhood is noted for an arty, diverse population and supports good restaurants and trendy galleries.
  • Cherokee Seneca: This neighborhood has a lot of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks which contributes to an exciting nightlife!
  • Crescent Hill: When you want your life in Louisville to be a lovely mix of fine Victorians and a suburban feel, then go for Crescent Hill. You’d find everything within walking distance of the avenue with its boutiques, shops, eateries and watering holes.

See also: Rooms For Rent In Los Angeles

Average rent in Louisville

Life in Louisville as a rentee can be comfortable. The average size for rooms for rent in Louisville, KY is 936 square feet, but this number varies greatly depending on unit type. Studio apartments are the smallest and most affordable, and the median rent for rooms in Louisville is $1,002.

University life in Louisville

The vibrant music and performing arts scene, locally-owned restaurants add a lot of color the the student life in Louisville. Universities provide opportunities to connect, and become involved in the campus community through a variety of recreational programs. Here are the top 5 universities in Louisville.

  • University of Louisville
  • Bellarmine University
  • Sullivan University
  • Spalding University
  • Jefferson Community and Technical College

How transit friendly is Louisville?

As with most American cities, transportation in Louisville, Kentucky is based primarily on automobiles. Study says Louisville residents use public transportation at one of the lowest rates among the nation’s largest cities. If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Louisville, you need be familiar with the transits available.

1. Walkability in Louisville

Louisville-Jefferson is the 43rd most walkable large city in the US. You can walk to restaurants and bars around. If you’re near Eastern, you’re a 20-minute walk to any restaurant, coffee shop, boutique, or bar you could feasibly want.

2. Roads/traffic in Louisville

In the city, the rush hour traffic is between 7:30-9 a.m. and 4-6 p.m. You can even plan your morning commute or road trip to Louisville, with the help of live traffic cams and local road condition reports.

See also: Rooms for Rent in Brooklyn, NY

3. Taxis in Louisville

Louisville offers great taxi services, with zTrip at the airport. Life in Louisville isn’t complete without alternative ride sharing companies, such as Uber and Lyft.

4. Public transportation in Louisville

The Transit Authority of River City (TARC) is the major public transportation provider for the Louisville, Kentucky, United States metro area, which includes parts of Southern Indiana. Keep in mind, single ride – $2.75 exact change. Also, cash fare does not include transfer trips.

5. Airports in Louisville

Being the 16th largest city in the United States, Louisville has 3 main airports. These airports and their websites offer facilities that cater to flyers’ comfort.

  • Louisville International Airport
  • Louisville Muhammad Ali International Airport
  • Bowman Field

6. Cycling in Louisville

With recent pushes to make the downtown area more walkable and bikeable and the planned Louisville Loop trail connecting parks and neighborhoods circling the city – life in Louisville is getting a lot convenient day by day.

Cultural activities in Louisville

Though horse racing is one of the many things Louisville famous for, there are many more artisans. Head over to The Speed Art Museum, where you’ll see a special exhibit that includes works by Rembrandt. At Kentucky Museum of Art and Craft, you will find wonderful exhibits, such as innovative woodwork and textile creations, but you’ll also discover terrific gift items by 200 different artists. More art and shopping await at Glassworks, where you can watch the glassblowers at work and then buy a finished piece. How cool!

Restaurants in Louisville

This city in Kentucky is known for a lot of foods, especially the world renowned Kentucky Fried Chicken (KFC). Here are a few restaurants you don’t want to miss out on!

Mayan Café

Bistro Le Relais

610 Magnolia

Havana Rumba

There’s a lot more to try. As you’re on the hunt for rooms for rent in Louisville, don’t forget to explore! Get going and live your best life in Louisville!

Other Blogs You Might Find Interesting :
